```{r}
if (!require("utils")) install.packages("utils")
if (!require("dplyr")) install.packages("dplyr")

library(utils)
library(dplyr)

# The excel file contains several sheets containing all my data
# The csv file contains only variables of my model. Hence I dowload my DB with read.csv2
DB<-data.frame(read.csv2("DataBase_010418.csv", sep = ";",stringsAsFactors=FALSE, header = TRUE ))
## This DB will be used for analysis with my dependent variable = ROA

# I select only row where TobinsQ <> zero . This database will be used when my dependent vairable = TobinsQ

DB_Tobin <- filter(DB, !is.na(TobinsQ))
write.csv2(DB_Tobin, file = "DB_Tobin.csv")
```
